name: Patellar Tendinitis
chief_complaint: Pain below my kneecap that gets worse when I jump or run
symptoms: Localized pain just below the kneecap
physical_findings: Tenderness at the patellar tendon insertion
Possible mild swelling at inferior pole of patella
treatment: Physical therapy focusing on eccentric quadriceps exercises
prognosis: Excellent with proper rest and rehabilitation, typically resolves within weeks to months
description: Inflammation of the patellar tendon, commonly seen in athletes who perform frequent jumping activities (jumper's knee). Results from repetitive stress on the tendon connecting the kneecap to the shinbone.
